head.title: DE BEERS IN BID FOR WINSPEAR

hedline.hl1: DE BEERS IN BID FOR WINSPEAR

abstract.p: De Beers Consolidated Mines of South Africa makes bid worth 259 million Canadian dollars, or $176 million, for Winspear Diamonds of Vancouver, British Columbia, which controls diamond property in northern Canada; Winspear calls offer hostile and insufficient; graph (S)

block.p: De Beers Consolidated Mines of South Africa has made a bid worth 259 million Canadian dollars, or $176 million, for Winspear Diamonds of Vancouver, British Columbia, which controls a diamond property in northern Canada. The offer of 4.25 Canadian dollars a share, a 77 percent premium to Friday's market price, caused Winspear shares to surge 1.77 Canadian dollars, to 4.17 dollars. Winspear called the offer hostile and insufficient. De Beers has limited operations in Canada.

The offer of 4.25 Canadian dollars a share, a 77 percent premium to Friday's market price, caused Winspear shares to surge 1.77 Canadian dollars, to 4.17 dollars. Winspear called the offer hostile and insufficient. De Beers has limited operations in Canada.
